template.name: Template pfSense Active
template.description: Active template for pfsense, requires pfsense_zbx.php installed to pfSense Box

item.name: Maximum number of opened files
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: Maximum number of processes
item.description: It could be increased by using sysctrl utility or modifying file /etc/sysctl.conf.

item.name: Expected CARP Status
item.description: Expected CARP Status

item.name: CARP Status
item.description: pfSense CARP Status

item.name: Gateway Status Raw
item.description: Gateway Status Raw

item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Processor load (1min/core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (5min/core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (15min/core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent doing nothing.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The amount of time the CPU has been servicing hardware interrupts.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that have been niced.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running the kernel and its processes.

item.name: CPU $2 time
item.description: The time the CPU has spent running users' processes that are not niced.

item.name: Host name
item.description: System host name.

item.name: System information
item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: Active memory
item.description: quantité de mémoire en cours d'utilisation par les processus

item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: Buffered memory
item.description:
Cache d'entrées des IO disque.
(Item désactivé car buggé)

item.name: Cached memory
item.description: quantité de mémoire utilisée pour mettre des données en cache

item.name: Free memory
item.description: quantité de mémoire complètement libre et prête a être utilisée directement.

item.name: Inactive memory
item.description: quantité de mémoire qui contient des données qui ne sont plus utilisées (peut être directement libéré si besoin)

item.name: Available memory (percent)
item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: Shared memory
item.description:
quantité de mémoire partagée entre plusieurs processus
(Item désactivé car non utilisé)

item.name: Total memory
item.description: quantité de mémoire totale

item.name: Used memory
item.description: Item désactivé car non utilisé

item.name: Wired memory
item.description: quantité de mémoire utilisée par le kernel, ne peut être ni déchargée en swap, ni compressée.

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of network interfaces as defined in global regular expression "Network interfaces for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Gateway {#GATEWAY} is forced down
trigger_prototype.description: Gateway is forced down by system administrator

trigger_prototype.expression:
{Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[service_value,{#SERVICE},status].last()}=0 and (
({Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[service_value,{#SERVICE},run_on_carp_slave].last()}=1 and {Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[carp_status].last()}=2)
or
( {Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[carp_status].last()}=1)
or
({Template pfSense Active:pfsense.value[carp_status].last()}=0) )
trigger_prototype.name: Service {#DESCRIPTION} is not running

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of file systems of different types as defined in global regular expression "File systems for discovery".

trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}
Free inodes is less than 20% on volume {#FSNAME}

trigger.name: CARP Status not Expected on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: pfSense CARP is not in the state Expected. This means that a failover could be in process.

trigger.name: Configured max number of opened files is too low on {HOST.NAME}
Configured max number of processes is too low on {HOST.NAME}
Lack of available memory on server {HOST.NAME}
Lack of free swap space on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: It probably means that the systems requires more physical memory.

trigger.name: New Version Available on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Noify of new version of pfsense available

trigger.name: pfSense Gateway Status Changed on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: Gateway Status Change, for use with an acion Script (e.g. update DNS record)

trigger.name: Processor load is too high on {HOST.NAME}
